intro: Navarretia atractyloides var. hamata, commonly known as the hairyspike larkspur, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its slender, hairy stems and clusters of blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. It produces small, greenish-brown fruits that contain seeds dispersed by wind. Navarretia atractyloides var. hamata is often found in California and adjacent regions, where it thrives in sunny, well-drained soils.
